data.title: fix memset calls
data.body: Order is "mem, val, count", not "mem, count, val"

data.title: Some QOL improvements for Asset Library interface
data.body:
The Asset Library is not very polished yet, so I wanted to make some pointers about the interface and open the discussion.

![asset-lib-qol](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5599796/16174340/d5c4aab4-3593-11e6-8d60-0d04cd67e6d0.png)

The interface is a bit cryptic and it's hard to tell what some buttons and links do.
- The "Support.." come from Blender's "Supported", but the interface there is different (it actually shows the list, not only when you click). So I proposing this to something like "Channels" (which reminds me of  apt) or "Stability" (which is not quite what it means, but because of the "Testing" that seems to apply).
- The double-arrow button after Sorting has no tooltip. I suppose it means "Ascending/Descending", but the icon doesn't help. Is pressed ascending or descending? Some standard "AZ" icon would be better.
- The pagination numbers are bizarre. What do they mean? What is "0-0/1"? Also, they occupy way to much space. Since there's only one item, I'm not sure how the navigation will work.
- The category in the item is a link. If this link will make the Library go that category, then that'll be okay, but what happens now is that the category changes when you click on the asset.
- The "test-hash" below the category I suppose it's the asset version (though in the asset page it shows an actual version number, so why the hash shows here?). It is also a link. Where will it point to?

data.title: Removed lots of prints
data.body: maybe fixes all of the prints reported in #5031

data.title: editor_node.cpp now takes care of removing plugin after deactivating it
data.body:
Time ago I have created a PR(#4174) that later was merged. A week ago I was looking into the code to find what crashes after disabling a plugin. So I have mede this little change to try fixing crash when disabling plugin. 

With that, the plugin gets removed by using the remove_editor_plugin() existent method instead of just removing from editor_data. 

Also removes from the active plugins list if it is on that list... 

As a bonus, this change seems to solve #5273.

data.title: Fix #5263: Useless preprocessor condition
data.body: Removes the useless preprocessor conditions `CHARTYPE_16BITS` and  disables`USE_QUAD_VECTORS` since it seems there was some work/some implementation may be done in the future there.

data.title: Tree: item_selected signal is emitted more times for one click in mode SELECT_ROW
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux 4.5.0-kali1-amd64, git b587a13293840975b53bad3392374ad30a578064

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
After a click on a TreeItem in a Tree in SELECT_ROW mode, more item_selected signals are emitted. Seems like a item_selected signal is emitted for each column the Tree has, I don't think this is intended behavior. Is it?

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a Tree
2. Assign a script to it
3. set_colums(3)
4. create some items
5. set_select_mode(SELECT_ROW)
6. attach to item_selected
7. click on items, signal is emitted for each column, even though only one item was selected.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Scripts created in the Inspector don't have a template code
data.body:
Creating a bug report that describes the issue that #1737 tried to address, as I want to close the latter PR which uses a too complex implementation for a relatively basic problem.

---

Creating a new GDScript resource from the inspector (with "New GDScript") creates an empty script, while adding a new script with the "Add Script" node option or with "File > New" in the script editor adds a useful script template.

data.title: Classref: Mutex, Semaphore, Thread, *Array
data.body: Various class reference additions.

data.title: COW mode
data.body:
In GDScript, creating an array or dictionary with literals (`[]` or `{}` respectively) will create them in shared mode.
Creating them with `Array()` or `Dictionary()` will create them in copy-on-write mode.
Not sure about pooled arrays, I think they're always in COW mode.
AFAIK this is unintended, either way it's undocumented.

GDScript probably shouldn't have access to COW stuff at all

I have a script that demonstrates the issue here: https://github.com/eska014/gdscripts/blob/b54ec14/cow_mode.gd

data.title: Added editor file dialog shortcuts
data.body: Added editor file dialog shortcuts.

data.title: Editor plugin is not removed if changed while active
data.body:
If a plugin scene or code is changed while it's active, it won't be removed when deactivated and a new one will be added when reactivated.

![godot windows opt tools 64_2016-06-18_13-40-14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5599796/16172237/a11240a8-355a-11e6-92a8-45559d270ebc.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a project.
2. Add this plugin in the `addons/custom_dock` folder of the project: https://github.com/godotengine/godot-demo-projects/tree/master/plugins/custom_dock.
3. Activate it in project settings.
4. In `dock_plugin.gd` change `DOCK_SLOT_LEFT_UL` to `DOCK_SLOT_LEFT_UR`.
5. Deactivate the plugin. Notice the dock doesn't go away.
6. Activate the plugin again. A new custom dock is added.

data.title: List of virtually empty source files to potentially drop
data.body:
While reviewing all source files for #5248 and #5255, I found many files which are almost empty (sometimes fully empty as if never implemented, sometimes a bare structure for a C++ class that probably never was implemented either). This issue is meant to list them all so that they can be discussed, and if agreed upon, dropped.

---

_Tick the checkbox if the corresponding files have been dropped (or if it was decided to keep them)._
## 1. Empty pair (.cpp + .h) or header-only empty template
- [x] `core/math/bezier_curve.*`
- [x] `core/balloon_allocator.h`: Redirects to `core/allocators.h` where BalloonAllocator is actually implemented.
- [x] `core/fpstr.*`
- [x] `core/script_debugger_debugger.cpp`
- [x] `core/variant_call_bind.h`: just includes `variant.h`
- [x] `scene/2d/node_2d_singleton.*`
- [x] `scene/animation/transitioner.*`: empty C++ structure + commented out API (probably an early Tween class?)
- [x] `scene/main/scene_singleton.*`: just includes `reference.h`
- [x] `tools/editor/default_saver.*`
- [x] `tools/editor/editor_selection.*`
- [x] `tools/editor/editor_vu.*`
- [x] `tools/editor/optimized_save_dialog.*`
## 2. Empty .cpp with non-empty .h
- [x] `core/math/math_defs.cpp`
- [x] `core/pair.cpp`
- [x] `core/vmap.cpp`
- [x] `core/vset.cpp`
- [x] `drivers/chibi/cp_file_access_wrapper.cpp`
- [x] `drivers/chibi/cp_player_data_reserved.cpp`
- [x] `servers/audio/voice_rb_sw.cpp`
- [x] `servers/physics/constraint_sw.cpp`
- [x] `servers/physics/joints/jacobian_entry_sw.cpp`
- [x] `servers/physics_2d/constraint_2d_sw.cpp`
## 3. Empty class definitions
- [x] `core/multi_bucket_array.h`
- [x] `modules/gdscript/gd_pretty_print.*`
- [x] `platform/android/java_bind.*`
- [x] `scene/3d/navigation_agent.*`
- [x] `scene/3d/optimized_spatial_scene.*`
- [x] `scene/gui/custom_button.*`
- [x] `scene/main/misc.*`
- [x] `scene/resources/height_map_shape.*`
- [x] `scene/resources/rich_text.*`
- [x] `servers/audio/reverb_buffers_sw.*`
- [x] `tools/editor/plugins/animation_data_editor_plugin.*`
- [x] `tools/editor/scenes.*`
## 4. `#if 0`'ed files
- [x] `core/res_ptr.*`
- [x] `scene/resources/gibberish_stream.*` (kept for now as a reference to #3307)
- [x] `scene/resources/volume.*`
- [x] `servers/physics/joints_sw.*`
- [x] `servers/visual/shader_compiler.*`
- [x] `servers/visual/shader_graph.*`
- [x] `tools/editor/plugins/control_editor_plugin.*`
## 5. Useless 3rd party files
- [x] `drivers/nedmalloc/{nedmalloc.{sln,vcproj}`
- [x] `drivers/png/example.c`
- Probably many others

data.title: LineEdit cursor fixes and improvements
data.body:
- Fixed weird text selection behaviours.
- Added OSX hotkeys.
- Added word jumping with <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>←</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>→</kbd> (<kbd>Alt</kbd> instead of <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> on OSX).

Fixes #1004

data.title: Added Tile Origin = Bottom Left option to the TileMap
data.body:
I find it useful to have the tile origins in my tileset at the bottom left corner. In a game in 3/4 view, the point which decides if an object is in front of another is often the one at the bottom of the sprite (if the shapes are simple enough). Since y-sort sorts by the origin of the tiles and other objects, it would be nice to have the possibility to use tiles with the origin at the bottom. This is already doable by using the offset when creating a tileset, but in the TileMap the tiles will then appear above the cursor (if you choose Tile Origin = Top Left). See also the issue https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3892. 

I added an option for tiles with the origin at the bottom left and want to contribute this small addition to the project.

data.title: Search in script should scroll line to the center
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.0.3, Windows 10 64 bits:

When I search something in a script, the editor scrolls down to that line, but I cannot see what's next. This is not convenient because I loose half of the context. 
It would be better to scroll the line to the center of the view, like any other editor does (Sublime; Npp++, VS...).

![godot_search_scroll_down](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/16170786/deb30358-355e-11e6-96f0-5b212ba85070.png)

Could be referred in https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2982

data.title: correctly parse floats in scientific notation (Fix #5267)
data.body:
well, that was easier than expected...

Fixes #5267

data.title: GDScript parses scientific notation of floats incorrectly
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.0.3 and current master

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
GDScript accepts a scientific notation float like `1e-10`, but parses it as 110. It just skips the `e-` (or `e` when using positive exponents). Writing `1.0e-10` for example works as expected.

GDScript should either correctly parse those values, even if it parses floats differently than other languages (`1.` must be written as `1.0`), or it should cause an error, analogue to writing `1.`.

data.title: Add @GDScript.type_exists
data.body:
Expose `ObjectTypeDB::type_exists` as `@GDScript.type_exists`.

Close #5220

data.title: Create floating game window by default (for tiled WMs)
data.body:
Godot works great on WMs like i3, which is very cool and makes development a lot faster.

Game windows, however, would benefit from being floating by default, even on tiled WMs, unless it's specified otherwise in Project Settings > Display.

This is because:
1. Nobody plays games (except maybe roguelikes) in tiled mode. This means that even for tiled WM users, it would make more sense to test the game as most users would play it
2. Games that aren't coded with resizability in mind will break (the most important reason, IMHO)

data.title: Cannot set constant to an API constant
data.body:
Godot 2.0.3, Windows 10, 64 bits

``` gdscript
const HOTKEY_TOGGLE = KEY_F3
```

Produces an error, both in code editor and playing the game:
`Parser Error: Expected constant expression`

I expected it to work because KEY_F3 and the like are constants.

Similar to the PI constant, a while ago https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2134: the fix was to move PI inside the language. In this case you cannot do that for every constant in the engine, so it would be a better fix to make engine constants work the same as user-defined ones.

data.title: Useless preprocessor condition
data.body:
There's a condition for the definition (or not) of `CHARTYPE_16BITS`, but such macro is never defined in the buildsystem. A Google search only points to this repository, so it is not defined by any system either.

There are three checks for it:
- https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/ebbd705b63d44d6f25949f6fda9bacf8d974c8bd/core/ustring.h#L49
- https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/c195c0df6b36debc870216dd42e49fbda70fa861/core/variant.h#L205
- https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/4bb93c976c6b67b4538c8a012ea549ec24e3ac1a/core/variant.cpp#L1448

But since it isn't defined anywhere, those checks will always evaluate to `true`. So I believe they could be removed.

data.title: Add button_down and button_up signals
data.body:
And improve the documentation on the `BaseButton` signals.

Related to #4625.

data.title: Improve filters in AnimationTree
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Godot last build

**Issue description**:

Filters in the AnimationTree are somehow conterintuitive, I think that filters can be improved.
Take for example a Blend2Node. What does it mean to filter some tracks on that node? Are you filtering the animation coming from input A or B?
I've looked at the code because I can't get the behavior I want in the animation tree, and things seem a bit confsing to me, so... My proposal is:

A filter should be a node in the animation tree on its own. The effect of filteting out a track should be to have that track for every animation sub node to have a weight of zero. For example:

```
Anim1 <----- +
             |
Anim2 <----  Blend3Node <---------- Filter<----- Blend2Node<-----Out
             |                                       |
Anim3 <----- +                             Anim4 <---+
```

If the Filter is set to filter track x, y and z, then for Anim1, Anim2, and Anim3, these tracks should have a weight of zero in the final blending.
Multiple filters should accumulate unsing an OR logic. That is a filter can only filter out tracks. Tracks that have been already filtered get no effect.

data.title: seed() not working correctly with float value
data.body:
```
randomize()
seed(0.1)
print(randf())
seed(0)
print(randf())
```

It print the same value.

On documentation it says:
_Nil seed ( float seed )
Set seed for the random number generator._

data.title: TextEdit: Change font size with Ctrl+Mouse Wheel Up/Down
data.body:
a.k.a. zoom

I used a timer to avoid slowing down because of many consecutive mouse wheel events.

~~I am not sure if adding #ifdefs for TOOL_ENABLED in scene/\* is ok.~~ Never mind, I moved it to CodeTextEditor.

Suggestions welcome.

data.title: Renamed Trackpad Hint to Emulate 3 Button Mouse.
data.body: Had an issue using the term "3D" without the editor creating whitespace between those characters. Used "Enable Trackpad" instead. Closes #5254.

data.title: Ability to play the project using an optimized binary from the editor
data.body:
If an user has installed export templates, it should be possible to play the project on a PC using the optimized binary (release mode), for improved performance while keeping fast iteration in development (since the button and keyboard shortcut would be integrated into the editor), at the cost of debugging features.

This would be helpful to test the "real" performance of a game without needing to export.
